paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a pathogenic variant in the TTR gene associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with cardiac and neurological symptoms

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive neurological symptoms, heart failure, cardiomegaly, left ventricular hypertrophy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient underwent successful heart transplantation, and subsequent genetic testing revealed a pathogenic variant, NM_000371.3:c.425T>C (p.Val142Ala).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with ATTRv amyloidosis in 2018, treated for heart failure.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing using a blood sample revealed the presence of a transthyretin (TTR) pathogenic variant, NM_000371.3:c.425T>C (p.Val142Ala), which was confirmed in her older brother.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis affecting both the nerves and heart.

variants.segregation_data: Confirmed in family members, specifically the patient's older brother.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This variant has not been previously reported in Korea.
key_quotes: This case highlights a rare pathogenic variant, NM_000371.3:c.425T>C (p.Val142Ala), which has not been previously reported in Korea.
The identification of a new pathogenic variant in this case underscores the need for continued research on the genetic diversity of ATTRv amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
